rules.title: Height measurement datum for structures on land with natural slope ≤ 10%

Qualifiers.scope: Determination of vertical datum for measuring the height of a building or structure.
applicability: Parcels where the natural slope is less than or equal to 10%.
exclusions: Parcels where the natural slope is greater than 10%.
Daylight plane measurements (handled under separate rule).

dimensional.name: natural_slope_percent
dimensional.description: The natural slope of the land, expressed as a percentage, prior to any grading or fill.

dimensional.name: existing_grade_elevation_adjacent
dimensional.description: Adjacent ground elevation prior to grading or fill.
dimensional.unit: ft (elevation datum as adopted by jurisdiction)

dimensional.name: lowest_point_existing_grade
dimensional.description: The lowest point of adjacent ground elevation (pre-fill) around the building/structure perimeter.
dimensional.unit: ft (elevation datum as adopted by jurisdiction)

dimensional.name: structure_height
dimensional.description: Vertical distance from the applicable grade datum to the measurement point on the structure.

Constants.name: slope_threshold_inclusive
Constants.definition: Boundary at or below which this rule applies.

Conditions.statement: Use Existing Grade as the datum for measuring structure height.
Conditions.logic: IF natural_slope_percent <= 10% THEN datum = Existing Grade

Conditions.statement: Existing Grade is defined as the lowest point of adjacent ground elevation prior to grading or fill, evaluated per building or structure.

Conditions.logic: Unclear if measurement is to 'highest point of roof', 'highest point of structure', or other benchmark.
Conditions.notes: Ambiguity flagged; cannot be used for automated validation without clarification.

hierarchical.note: Rule pertains to grade-based height measurement.

rules.title: Height measurement datum and limit for structures on land with natural slope > 10%

Qualifiers.scope: Determination of vertical datum and limiting criteria for measuring the height of a building or structure on sloping sites.
applicability: Parcels where the natural slope is greater than 10%.
exclusions: Parcels where the natural slope is less than or equal to 10%.
Daylight plane measurements (handled under separate rule).

dimensional.name: natural_slope_percent
dimensional.description: The natural slope of the land, expressed as a percentage, prior to any grading or fill.

dimensional.name: existing_grade_elevation_at_point
dimensional.description: Existing (pre-fill) adjacent ground elevation at a given point along the structure.
dimensional.unit: ft (elevation datum as adopted by jurisdiction)

dimensional.name: finished_grade_elevation_at_point
dimensional.description: Finished (post-grading/fill) adjacent ground elevation at a given point along the structure.
dimensional.unit: ft (elevation datum as adopted by jurisdiction)

dimensional.name: selected_grade_elevation_at_point
dimensional.description: The lower of the existing or finished grade elevations at a given point along the structure, used as the datum.
dimensional.unit: ft (elevation datum as adopted by jurisdiction)

dimensional.name: structure_height_at_point
dimensional.description: Vertical distance from the selected datum at a given point to the corresponding height point on the structure.

Constants.name: slope_threshold_exclusive
Constants.definition: Boundary above which this rule applies.

Constants.name: max_height_above_existing_grade
Constants.definition: Apparent maximum height above existing grade indicated in figure.

Constants.name: max_height_above_finished_grade
Constants.definition: Apparent maximum height above finished grade indicated in figure.

Conditions.statement: Use Grade as the datum for measuring structure height, defined per-point along the structure as the lower of existing or finished grade.
Conditions.logic: FOR EACH point p along the structure: datum(p) = min(existing_grade(p), finished_grade(p))

Conditions.statement: Compliance must be checked at all points along the slope using the lower of the applicable limits.
Conditions.logic: FOR EACH point p: permissible_height(p) = min(max_height_above_existing_grade, max_height_above_finished_grade) AND measured_height(p) <= permissible_height(p)
Conditions.source: Figure 45 label: 'The structure must comply with the lower of the two limits at all points along the slope.'
Conditions.notes: Where specific numeric limits are jurisdictional; figure shows 30 ft values but may be illustrative.

Conditions.statement: If numeric height limits relative to existing and finished grade are both specified, the stricter (lower) limit governs at every point.
Conditions.logic: IF both limits exist THEN governing_limit(p) = min(limit_existing, limit_finished)

hierarchical.note: Rule pertains to grade-based height measurement on steep slopes.

crossReferences.caption: Height limits for structures on slopes greater than 10%

rules.title: Daylight plane datum using Average Grade

Qualifiers.scope: Determination of vertical datum for measuring a daylight plane.
applicability: Daylight plane calculations for buildings or structures.
exclusions: Height measurements for structures on slopes ≤ 10% (see R1).
Height measurements for structures on slopes > 10% (see R2).

dimensional.name: grade_at_building_midpoint
dimensional.description: The grade at the midpoint of the building along the relevant measurement line.
dimensional.unit: ft (elevation datum as adopted by jurisdiction)

dimensional.name: grade_at_closest_point_on_abutting_site
dimensional.description: The grade at the closest point on the abutting site to the measurement location.
dimensional.unit: ft (elevation datum as adopted by jurisdiction)

dimensional.name: average_grade
dimensional.description: Arithmetic mean of the grade at the building midpoint and the grade at the closest point on the abutting site.
dimensional.unit: ft (elevation datum as adopted by jurisdiction)

usage.name: daylight_plane_usage
usage.description: Use average_grade as the baseline for projecting or evaluating the daylight plane.

Conditions.statement: Use Average Grade as the datum for daylight plane measurement.

hierarchical.note: Rule pertains to grade-based datum for daylight plane.

crossReferences.caption: Illustrations of daylight plane using average grade
Comparison of different grades
crossReferences.note: Illustrative; interior numeric/ratio labels not legible.

logicalDependencies.note: Daylight plane datum selection is separate from height measurement datum selection.

rules.title: General height measurement to the highest point (ambiguous)

Qualifiers.scope: Potential general rule for the target point of height measurement.
applicability: All structures where height is measured.

dimensional.name: height_target_point
dimensional.description: The point on the structure to which height is measured.

Conditions.logic: Unclear whether height is measured to the highest point of the roof, structure, or other element.
Conditions.notes: Insufficient clarity for enforcement; requires confirmation from original source.

hierarchical.note: Mentioned within the context of grade/height measurement figures.

logicalDependencies.note: If clarified, this rule would define the vertical measurement target used with the datum selected in R1 or R2.

validation_considerations.completeness: All table rows and figure-derived enforceable items are represented. Numeric height limits from Figure 45 are included with caution.
validation_considerations.accuracy: Slope threshold values and datum definitions are captured verbatim. The 30 ft limits may be illustrative; flagged accordingly.
ambiguities_flagged: Whether the 30 ft limits in Figure 45 are normative or illustrative.
consistency_checks: Ensure slope classification is mutually exclusive between R1 and R2.
For R2, compute datum and limits per-point along the structure and apply the lower of available limits.
